name: Meet the Funders - The Success Circuit!
html_description:
Calling ambitious business owners with plans to supercharge their business!


We're bringing together funding and business support providers under one-roof, to demystify the myths of funding and finance and provide expert advice to get your growth plans in to action.

With presentations from our Business experts you will hear about various business funding offers and learn about the free support available to help your company grow and prosper. 

Our inspirational headline speaker is Marc Ford, business author and editor of ‘The Small Business Growth Magazine’. Marc is a seasoned business coach who will provide a ‘lightning bolt’ of motivation and enthusiasm for the audience to take their business to the next level. 

In addition, the event will feature ‘FREE Business Support Surgeries’ (individual 20 minute slots bookable on the day). Meet with our highly experienced business advisers who will be on hand to offer FREE business support advice during a one-to-one appointment. They will help you assess your current position to determine what type of finance and support is appropriate for you. 


Attendees will:

  • Meet funders and speak to experts
  • ‘Plug-in’ to the business support and funding available to help energise your business success. 
  • Identify support organisations that can help achieve personal business ambitions
  • Meet and network with like-minded businesses
  • Highlight business activities, build networks, share knowledge and create collaboration opportunities
  • Contribute to building a strong and vibrant business community


Funders and business support providers attending this event include: 

• Business Gateway growth hub 
• British Business Bank 
• De Montfort University 
• Department for International Trade 
• Department for Trade and Industry 
• Enterprise Loans East Midlands 
• Federation of Small Businesses 
• First Enterprise 
• Food and Drink Forum 
• Foresight Group 
• Innovate UK 
• Leicester Employment Hub 
• Loughborough University 
• Leicestershire & Rutland Sports 
• Manufacturing Technology Centre 
• Maven Capital Partners 
• NBV 
• Sir Thomas White Charity 
• Skills Support for the Workforce 
• University of Leicester 
And more…. 

This event is aimed at small and medium-sized enterprises across Leicester and Leicestershire who are seeking advice, support and funding to grow and develop their business.

Confirmed Speaker:

Marc Ford, Business Author and Editor of The Small Business Growth Magazine

Agenda:
8am Registration, breakfast and networking 
Funding presentations & case studies 
Motivational business speaker 
Opportunity to meet the funders and business networking 
One to one business support surgeries (pre-booked) 
12noon Event close

name: What Can Possibly Go Wrong? Cybersecurity Hints & Tips
html_description:
With cyber-attacks on the rise, and the protection of data of increasing importance, being aware of the risks and knowing how to respond to them is vital. This seminar will provide you with a number of hints and tips to help protect you from cybersecurity attacks or recover should the worst come to the worst.

During the session we will explore:

  • How you can prepare your systems in case of an attack, including conducting audits and putting effective back up systems in place
  • How to protect your business against an attack
  • How to detect an attack so you can deal with it as soon as possible
  • How to respond to an attack – what are the key steps you need to take?
  • How to recover any documents or files lost or damaged
  • Reviewing cyber-attacks after they happen in order to establish what happened and what can be improved to ensure the same thing doesn’t happen again

This event is aimed at owners of small businesses, with no in-house IT support, IT managers & directors of larger businesses and organisations where the IT department does not have in-house cybersecurity expertise.

Attendees will come away with an action list of things to check or do that will help prevent successful cyber attacks on their organisations or how to recover after a cyber attack.

Agenda

9am Networking, tea / coffee & breakfast rolls

9.30am Start of seminar

10.30am – 11am Close of seminar

11am Networking, discussion and questions

12noon Finish

name: #DMUworks Graduate Recruitment & Placements Fair
html_description:
Would you like to network with DMU students and and graduates with a view to recruiting suitable future employees?

If so, you may be interested in exhibiting at the DMUworks Graduate Recruitment and Placements Fair. The event attracts approximately 2000 students across the two days and 70 stands are available for organisations to exhibit each day.

The costs for exhibiting are:

£250 for one day

£350 for both days

Not for profit organisations and charities can benefit from a reduced rate of £100 for one day or £150 for two days.

If you are interested in booking a stand or finding out more, visit www.dmu.ac.uk/fairs or email Lisa Bilimoria lbilimoria@dmu.ac.uk

name: Opportunities in Clinical Data
html_description:
The use of clinical data, the application of artificial intelligence and the development of digital health have been predicted to revolutionise health care and the development of innovative new healthcare solutions.

This event will showcase the expertise in Leicester and the support available to engage with clinicians and healthcare experts to:

  • Refine products to meet needs
  • Access real word evidence
  • Deepen understanding of the health system
  • Showcase health facilities
  • Develop business models in order to progress product development
  • Gain access to the market

Attendees will also:

  • Learn more about what the NHS requirements are for new products/solutions
  • Find out how to access clinical expertise
  • Find out more funding opportunities to access expertise

The event is aimed at companies/entrepreneurs developing innovative healthcare solutions, specifically in digital health, Medtech and software solutions that would like to work in collaboration with clinical data experts to accelerate product development.

venue_name: Keith Weller Lounge, 1st Floor, King Power Stadium
name: The Business Quiz
html_description:
Join Lawson-West for The Business Quiz – a fun evening for you and your team at the King Power Stadium. Think pub quiz mixed with Who Wants to be a Millionaire? The Business Quiz will test your knowledge of the business life cycle. You and your team will get the chance to win prizes, whilst supporting local charity LOROS.

There will be 12 rounds of questions, the rounds will be hosted by different adviser companies who devise 10 questions in their round.

The question rounds follow a business life cycle theme from beginning to end: from start-up questions through to business sale - business investment, growth and development, premises, risk and protection, taxation, personal wealth, retirement and exit.

By the end of the quiz, business people in the audience will have tested their knowledge and learnt a little bit more about the development stages of a business, delivered in a fun and social way.

Lawson-West is running the quiz as a charity event and it will be supporting LOROS. Teams of 6 people are invited to take part.  The cost is £150 + VAT per team of 6. This price includes entry for 6 people in a quiz team, buffet food and networking session drinks. There will also be a cash bar, live music and atmospheric LED-lighting.

This event is aimed at business managers, business owners and directors, employee teams, business adviser professionals and their teams of 6 people. The fun quiz will help your team players to identify and learn more about business growth and development, whilst testing your brain and limitless knowledge.

Arrival is from 6pm for an hour’s networking with prompt 7pm quiz start. The event will finish by 10.30pm after prize-giving.

venue_name: Santander UK plc, Building 4 Carlton Park
name: Blaby District Means Business
html_description:
Join us for this networking meeting designed for local businesses to share and hear ideas to enable your business to grow and for boosting the local economy. Attendees will hear from our short speaker programme about local key development sites, how to access funding and lots of other ways your business can tap into the support currently on offer from Blaby District Council and from our partners.

This meeting is aimed at Blaby businesses who are interested in networking with other local businesses and partners. The short speaker programme covers various topics under the Business Support theme.

As well as a free breakfast, a warm welcome and lots of networking time, attendees will hear about:

  • Fully funded skills support
  • Apprenticeship schemes available for local businesses
  • Key local development sites
  • The wide range of business support services available to businesses in the Blaby district

 

Confirmed Speakers:

Howard Cordingley - SERCO

Katy Urwin / Chris Tullin - North Warwickshire & South Leics. College

John Richardson / Carole Troake - Blaby District Council

 

Agenda:

8am Registration, networking and breakfast

8.30am Speaker programme which concludes

9.30am: Networking at 9:30

10am: Finish

name: Succession Planning Via Management Buyouts
html_description:
This breakfast seminar between Lawson-West Solicitors, Barclays and Mazars is aimed at business owners and directors who are interested to learn more about Management Buyouts and how they can be used to help their business in its succession planning strategy.

The seminar will look at management buyouts and how can they be introduced and adapted for management teams looking to encourage or develop the next generation in their business. It will discuss management buyouts in the business context of succession planning as well as the usefulness for exit planning and strategic business growth plans.

Speakers will include representatives from Lawson-West Solicitors, Barclays Bank and Mazars.

name: How to Create an Online Marketing Plan That Actually Works and Wins Customers
html_description:
Far too many small businesses don't have an online marketing plan and it's no small wonder that they get inconsistent results. But that doesn't have to be you. 

In this half-day seminar, you'll discover the key things you need to put into an online marketing plan to make your marketing (and your results) far more effective. 

You'll learn: 

  • How to work out which online marketing channels to use for maximum effect 
  • How to use website content to win in the search engines (and the most efficient way of doing it) 
  • Three essential (but simple) things that the online marketing 'gurus' don't want you to know 
  • How to plan your marketing to save time and money 
  • What's 'how right now' in online marketing 


The best thing about these approaches is that they’re nearly all free (or nearly). Armed with the right knowledge, they won’t cost you a penny. 

Better still is that you can begin to put some of them into effect as soon as you get back to your computer. 

You'll pick up a template for your online marketing plan that has been a proven method in recent years. 

By the end of the session you'll have a head-full of ideas and will have made a start on your own online marketing plan and then you can start to win more customers online.

This event is aimed at micro-businesses and the self-employed.

The workshop will give you loads of ideas to put into your own online marketing plan. 
You'll also have made a start on writing the plan, so you can get cracking as soon as you get back to your desk.

Confirmed Speaker:

Karl Craig-West of Buzz Website Design

name: Innovation Tax Incentives
html_description:
This workshop will explore the myths surrounding Research & Development tax reliefs and what type of projects or new product development could be eligible for this generous tax incentive. It will also cover Patent Box tax relief and is being delivered by an ex HMRC R&D Tax Inspector, so attendees will get a perspective from someone who has had a foot in both camps.

The workshop is aimed at anyone who is innovating, be it developing new products, materials, processes or software or for those wanting to find out about some of the tax incentives on offer in the UK.

Attendees will gain a greater understanding of how their company might benefit from R&D tax reliefs and what types of projects qualify.

Confirmed Speaker:

Darryl Hoy of Shorts Accountants

name: How to Resolve Disputes Quickly and Without Spending a Fortune
html_description:
Many businesses are likely to encounter conflict and disputes at some point, whether that’s with suppliers or customers. Disputes can occur for a variety of reasons, common disputes include landlord and tenant issues, an issue with a contract or a business not delivering as promised.

 Resolving disputes can be stressful, time consuming, extremely costly and ultimately take your focus away from your business.

 Commercial mediation is a great alternative to the usual litigation route and allows disputes between businesses or between businesses and their customers to be solved quickly and cost-effectively, without the need for court proceedings. This event, delivered by commercial mediator Tim Bennett, will explore the benefits of mediation and how the mediation process works.

The event is aimed at business owners and managers. Any business can be subject to a dispute. Knowing how to resolve these disputes quickly is the key to ensuring they don't impact the business and costs don't escalate.

Confirmed Speaker

Tim Bennett, is an experienced solicitor and accredited mediator. With over 25 years’ experience of commercial and civil dispute resolution, Tim has a wide practice area for both business clients and private individuals and he regularly represents clients at mediation. Tim has a particular interest in cases relating to professional negligence and contentious probate and is a member of the Professional Negligence Lawyers Association and the Association of Contentious Trust and Probate Specialists.

name: Science, Innovation and Entrepreneurship
html_description:
Leicester Business Voice (LBV) and the University of Leicester’ Innovation Hub, part-funded by European Regional Fund, are pleased to be hosting another joint event during the Leicester Business Festival. This year we are putting a spotlight on Science and Innovation based entrepreneurship. Successful Leicestershire based entrepreneurs will provide insights on how they have/are utilising Science and Innovation to inform their business plan, secure grant funding, gain higher profile and competitive advantage to grow their business. 

Delegates will hear from at least two successful Leicestershire businesses and the value they place on Science and Innovation and why. Plus, they will gain an overview on some of the innovation support available for businesses.

The event is aimed at entrepreneurs, business owners (pre start-up, early stage and established businesses) and professionals (accountants, solicitors, bank managers).

Delegates will:

  • Gain from targeted networking with the LBV (Leicester Business Voice) members (which includes professionals, universities and entrepreneurial successful businesses)
  • Pick up new information and useful insights from local successful business owners on how they used science and innovation to grow their business
  • Meet specialists from the University of Leicester and LBV and learn about innovation support available and how to access it

Confirmed Speakers:

Roger Merchant, LBV 
Anjuu Trevedi, LBV and University of Leicester 
 

Agenda

7.45am Registration, Breakfast and Networking 
8am  Welcome and Introductions 
8.30am Company Case Study 1 (tbc)
8.45am Company Case Study 2 (tbc)
9am Science and Innovation Support in Leicestershire 
9.15am Q&A & Networking 
9.30am Close

venue_name: Leicester City Football Club, King Power Stadium
name: Promise to Care: How Businesses Can Support Local Care Leavers
html_description:
This event will help businesses harness local talent, give back to the local community and make a real difference to vulnerable young people in Leicester and Leicestershire. It will introduce the Promise to Care, a new initiative from Leicestershire Cares which aims to involve more employers in supporting local care leavers to achieve their full potential, while providing flexible and accessible ways for businesses to deliver meaningful and lasting positive change in their local communities.

The event is suitable for any business interested in meaningful engagement with their local community, from all sectors and of all sizes.

Attendees will:

  • Benefit from practical advice and tips on supporting young people in the workplace
  • Learn from businesses who have benefitted from supporting care leavers
  • Hear from local care leavers about the difference their support can make to their lives.
  • Gain practical suggestions and advice to help your business harness the untapped talent of local care leavers
  • Access tailored support from Leicestershire Cares to maximise your business’s contribution to the local community and make a difference to vulnerable young people
  • Get the opportunity to join a growing group of local businesses who have pledged a range of support for local care leavers

 

Agenda

8.30am - 9am Arrival and refreshments / networking

9am - 9.10am Welcome and introduction (Leicestershire Cares)

9.10am - 9.30am The business benefits of supporting local care leavers

9.30am - 9.40am The difference employer support makes to care leavers

9.40am – 9.55am Case study: apprenticeships for care leavers

9.55am - 10am Thanks, acknowledgements and invite to sign up to promise

10am - 10.30am Attendees sign up to the Promise, networking and further refreshments

venue_name: Oadby and Wigston Borough Council Offices
name: Digital Support for SMEs (Wigston)
html_description:
Are you a Leicestershire SME missing out on FREE digital support?

Come along to this event to find out how to sign-up and access fully-funded digital support.

Leicester and Leicestershire businesses can benefit from a range of fully-funded workshops and seminars, the opportunity to receive financial help through grant funding and free one to one business advice to help introduce new digital technology.

The Digital Growth Programme is managed by East Midlands Chamber (Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire). It is a programme part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund, the Chamber and Leicestershire County Council and is designed to help SMEs embrace new digital technology to improve productivity to aid growth.

The programme team are holding a number of information sessions inviting local SMEs who haven’t yet taken advantage of the digital support to attend to learn more about the programme and how to access the FREE support available.

By attending delegates will:

  • Discover what digital support is on offer
  • Learn about the success of the programme
  • Learn how, by embracing digital technology, they can improve productivity and business performance
  • Find out how to register and access the support*
  • Learn more about the grant funding and how to apply*

*eligibility criteria applies

Please note: there is no parking available at the venue. The nearest car park is Holiday Inn NCP, St Nicholas Circle, Leicester. LE1 4LF

 

Agenda

9am Arrival and networking

9.30am Welcome and programme overview

10am Meet the team

10.30am Opportunity to register onto the programme

11am Networking and close

 

Confirmed Speaker

Kam Atker, Events and Engagement Officer, Digital Growth Programme

name: Competing as a 21st Century Tourism Destination
html_description:
The tourism landscape is changing. To remain competitive, businesses need to understand new trends in the industry to actively plan for the future. Leicester City Council and Leicestershire County Council will be launching a new Tourism Growth Plan for the region, a road map for the future outlining the response to tourism challenges enabling the region to establish itself as a recognised 'go-to' destination.

Speakers from Visit Britain and leading local tourist attractions who helped to shape the plan will share how the tourism sector is preparing for the years ahead. City Mayor, Sir Peter Soulsby, will be unveiling the refreshed Leicester Tourism Plan reflecting the city's response to the uplift in tourism since the discovery of the remains of King Richard III and Leicester City Football Club winning the Premier League.

The event is aimed at those involved in the management and marketing of local tourism businesses in both the leisure and busines tourism sectors. These tourism sectors include sports, art and culture, heritage, indoor and outdoor visitor attractions, food and drink, hotels and other accommodation providers, conference centres, transport providers as well as public sector and charitable trusts.

Attendees will gain valuable sector intelligence on emerging tourism trends and insights into the future growth plans and initiatives for the leisure and business tourism sectors to be delivered in Leicester and Leicestershire over the coming years. The event also offers an opportunity to network with other tourism business leaders and to hear about national tourism plans being developed by Visit Britain.

 

 

Confirmed Speakers:

City Mayor, Sir Peter Soulsby 

Cllr Trevor Pendleton – Cabinet Support Member – Leicestershire County Council

Sharon Redrobe OBE , CEO Twycross Zoo & Chair of Tourism Advisory Board 

Andrew Stokes - England Director, Visit Britain

 

Agenda

1.00pm Arrival & Registration 

1.30pm Welcome & Introduction (City Mayor Sir Peter Soulsby & Cllr Trevor Pendleton)

1.45pm Tourism Growth Plan (Sharon Redrobe OBE, Chair of the Tourism Advisory Board) 

2pm Keynote Speaker - Tourism future trends & how Visit Britain are supporting tourism businesses 

(Andrew Stokes, England Director - Visit Britain) 

2.30pm

- A Distinctive and Visible Destination

- Improving Productivity through Business Tourism

- Strategic Product Development - a showcase of some of the exciting new tourism developments

planned for our area

4pm  Break 

4.15pm City Action Plan launch

5pm Close and networking

name: The Third Annual Leicester & East Midlands Commercial Property Market Review
html_description:
Based on three years of data collection and research, this event will provide useful insights into the local commercial property market. The presentation will cover key developments and trends in the commercial property market over the last 12 months and identify key opportunities which are likely to provide the highest returns for investors.

Detailed comparisons and hot-spot maps will provide insights into the demand and supply of commercial property within (and between) key urban areas in the East Midlands (including Leicester, Derby, Loughborough, Nottingham and Northampton).

Attendees will gain a greater understanding of the Leicester and East Midlands commercial market. More specifically, individuals with a property sales and development background and interest will be able to use the information to understand local demand, supply and the availability of different sizes and types of property on the market.

In previous years the event has been particularly useful to property developers, investors, agents and policymakers. Tech4i2’s analysis can also assist local authorities and other organisations to find areas where there is ‘under’ and ‘over’-supply of commercial accommodation in the East Midlands.

In addition to the main presentation, there will also be an opportunity for group discussions and questions.

Tech4i2 has been working with commercial property developers, investors and public sector policymakers for more than 30 years. After three years of commercial property market data collection, and with the help of Leicester University, they have developed a robust methodology to identify whether there is insufficient small business premises and what type of premises should be developed to address gaps in market provision and to maximise returns at six digit postcode level.  The market analysis Tech4i2 provide is utilised by banks, investors, property developers and the public sector.

Confirmed Speakers:

Professor Paul Foley

Momin Ahsraf from Tech4i2

name: Preparing for China's E-Commerce Market
html_description:
The Chinese e-commerce market is the world’s largest global e-commerce market, and by sales value, is larger than all other global e-commerce markets combined. It is still growing at a tremendous rate - 23.9% (year-on-year 2018 vs 2017), and now accounts for 23% of the total retail sales in the market. The total retail market in China is expected to be larger than the US for the first time ever in 2019.

For any British business selling consumer products, who are serious about expanding into the world’s largest consumer market, understanding the structure and requirements for entry onto Chinese e-commerce is vital.

At the same time, the Chinese e-commerce environment is very different to other economies. The barriers to entry remain high, and the language, culture, legal environment and buying habits all require an approach tailored to China to succeed.

To help British businesses take advantage of the opportunities, The China-Britain Business Council (CBBC), the Department for International Trade, the Institute of Directors and Leicestershire LEP have put together a five part programme to lead companies from an introduction to the Chinese e-commerce market through to active trading in the market.

The first stage will be this half day introductory masterclass which will outline the opportunities and challenges of selling in the Chinese e-commerce market, and aims to equip businesses with the understanding to decide whether this opportunity is right for them, and the commitments required to be successful.

Attendees will learn about:

  •        Market background and information
  •        How Chinese e-commerce differs from that in Europe and North America
  •        Experience of a UK business trading on e-commerce sites in China
  •        The importance of social media and digital marketing
  •        What steps you need to take to prepare and protect your business in advance of trading in China
  •        Be invited to the rest of the five-part programme leading to active trading in China

venue_name: Civil Court, Leicester Castle Business School
name: Think Beyond Now: Resilient Leadership for Micro and Small Businesses
html_description:
This workshop invites business leaders from micro and small businesses to explore approaches that can improve their business resilience and competitiveness in fast-changing times.


The event features the ‘Leadership for Growth’ programme, which helps business leaders to introduce new approaches and technology applications to improve their personal and company performance. Participants will be able to join scheduled programmes and events for 2019-20. Delegates will also find out how to work with talented students to develop business innovation.

The event is aimed at leaders, founders and managers in micro and small businesses across all sectors. Delegates will be updated on the latest research and approaches for improving resilience, productivity and competitiveness through leadership in small firms, and find out how to access these. They will be able to meet experts and students in the ‘Leadership for Growth’ team and join a newly announced programme aiming to drive productivity in micro-firms.

Confirmed Speakers:

Professor David Rae, Director, Centre for Enterprise & Innovation 
Professor Felix Arndt, Professor of Strategic Management, Leicester Castle Business School
Louise Donaghy. Head of Executive Education, Leicester Castle Business School
Other invited speakers TBC

name: Socially Responsible Business: How CSR Can Benefit Your Business
html_description:
This event will showcase the role that corporate social responsibility (CSR) can play in helping companies to grow their business and enhance brand recognition. The event will also see the launch of a new programme for Leicester/shire called 'Think CSR'.

Attendees will gain insight into how socially responsible businesses are developing programmes and projects to address major issues globally or at a local level. There will be a specific focus on corporate partnerships and how these can be developed. Attendees will also hear about Think CSR, what it aims to achieve and plans for 2020, including a planned ‘Giving Day’ for Leicester. 

It is widely recognised that effective CSR can help organisations to increase company profits whilst also benefiting the wider community. This event will be useful for SMEs and medium sized companies in Leicestershire who are looking to:

Find out more about the benefits of CSR
Develop CSR plans and initiatives that will improve their triple bottom line
Link with relevant organisations and community-based partnerships

The event will be informed by recent research relating to how local companies understand and apply CSR and will include presentations, an ideation workshop (promoting social responsibility in Leicestershire) and the launch of the new ‘Think CSR’ programme for the region.

 

Confirmed Speakers:

Chris Hobson, Director of Policy, East Midlands Chamber

Professor Edward Cartwright, Director, Institute of Applied Economics and Social Value, De Montfort University

Chris Shaw, Director, Ethical Business Exchange.

Other speakers to be confirmed

 

Agenda

8.30am: Registration and refreshments

8.45am: Welcome from Chris Shaw

8.50am: Guest speakers

9.20am: Ideation workshop (promoting social responsibility in Leicester/shire)

9.45am: Think CSR launch

10am: Close and networking

name: Woman Who Inspires Network
html_description:
Join us at the Woman Who Inspires Network at The Belmont

Make new connections, learn something new and hear great local inspirational speakers who will share their business journey.

This event is open to all women in business, including those who have taken a career break or may be looking for a fresh challenge. Men are also welcome to attend.

Attendees will gain inspiration, motivation and learning from others in a supportive environment. The event also aims to help women in business to gain confidence to power up their personal brand and become role models to inspire others.

This event is delivered in partnership with the Federation of Small Businesses (FSB).

Agenda

9.30am Arrival, refreshments and networking - You can arrive any time from 9am but we understand that you may have travel and caring responsibilities, so please don't rush

10am Introductions & Welcome from Jennifer Thomas (Federation of Small Businesses)

10.10am Women in Business Speakers. Our speakers each share their personal journey into business including the challenges they have faced and how they have overcome them. You will also hear business tips and ways to power up your personal brand and your business. Speakers to be confirmed

11.10am Business Challenges/Issues Q&A with Panel

11.20am Power networking, updates, announcements and celebrations

11.30am Close and Networking

venue_name: The Langton Room, Harborough Innovation Centre
name: Coaching for High Performance (Harborough)
html_description:
We all want our people to perform to their best of their ability don't we? That's how our business get results. Come to this session and see how, by bringing coaching into your management style, you can improve not only your performance, but also your employees performance too. 

But this won't be your average coaching training session. That's not how we do things at Blue Grape! We've teamed up with TSF Laser Clays to combine learning with fun and new experiences.  After an introduction to the concept of coaching, and some practical coaching tools, you’ll be split into teams to practice those coaching skills by having a laser shooting contest. The aim is to coach, give and receive feedback and help your team score as many points as possible.  This is coaching for high performance after all…..

This event is great for anyone who's responsible for the performance of other people, such as Business Owners, Managers, Team Leaders or Supervisors, or anyone responsible for training and development in their business. If you want to find a way to increase the performance of people around you - you should attend this event!

Attendees will learn the basics of coaching for high performance and how to increase the performance of your employees, improving productivity and quality. We all want that don't we?

name: Be Part of A Winning Sports, Innovation & Enterprise Network
html_description:
Leicester-Shire and Rutland Sport in partnership with Loughborough University, LATi and inCharnwood invite you to a networking event that celebrates the innovation in sports and sports technology locally. 

Leicestershire is home to highly innovative companies and has a growing and thriving cluster of sports enterprises and Loughborough is recognised across the world for innovation in sports and sports technology. 

Come along and find out how you can connect with the growing cluster of sports businesses and be inspired by others who have made the most of the opportunities available through this network. 

During the event, Andy Reed the Vice Chair of the LLEP Board and a specialist adviser to a number of sports organisations, will share an update in relation to the Local Industrial Strategy and what this means for sports organisations. What's more he will host some discussions with some inspiring sports organisations who have connected with the extensive support network in Leicester and Leicestershire to grow and develop their business.

More details about the additional speakers to be confirmed soon.

This event is suitable for anyone involved in Sport, Innovation or Enterprise in the sport sector in Leicester and Leicestershire and further afield. From pre-start ups through to limited companies, National Governing Bodies of Sport, Leisure Trusts, Manufacturing and Sports technology businesses – everyone is welcome.

Attendees will gain:

  • A broader understanding of the support network available in Leicester and Leicestershire 
  • Inspiration from businesses who are benefiting through collaborations within the network 
  • A chance to connect with other businesses

Confirmed Speaker:

Andy Reed - Vice Chair of the Board of the LLEP, LRS Special Adviser, Loughborough University Adviser

More speakers to be announced

name: Playing With Strengths
html_description:
This event will get attendees thinking about the world of work, now and tomorrow, and why it’s more important than ever to understand your strengths so you can shape your job and protect your future.

Following an initial discussion, we’ll introduce you to a series of activities to help you explore your own strengths and really start to understand what they mean, how they combine in their own unique ways and how you can use them to your advantage. You’ll explore strengths you knew you had and also discover strengths that you might not be aware of.

This practical workshop will get you playing and thinking so that you leave with a better understanding of yourself, your true strengths and how these can be applied in the world of work, now and in the future. It is aimed at anyone who’d like to understand themselves and their strengths better. Whether you’re a graduate looking to find your first job or you’re an executive director seeking to bring more joy to your work, everyone can benefit from understanding what they are truly good at.

The event will begin with an initial story and discussion followed by a series of activities.

Confirmed Speakers:

Cat Hase, Creative Director, Imagine If Ltd

Barry Holmes, Artist, Zoom Creates Ltd

name: Leicestershire Entrepreneurship Day
html_description:
A day of inspirational guest speakers, panel Q&As, live and pre-recorded interviews and networking, this event will provide an opportunity to celebrate local entrepreneurial successes and to inspire delegates through individuals from outside the region sharing their stories. 

Hosted by DMUworks at De Montfort University, this event will provide delegates with inspiration, motivation, ideas, tips and networking opportunities with some of the region’s most exciting businesses.

50% of the tickets for this event will be reserved for students, enabling the local business community to meet and hear from new talent, whilst also ensuring students have an opportunity to mix with the local business community and to be motivated and inspired to better integrate with Leicester and Leicestershire entrepreneurs and organisations.

This event is sponsored by the Sir Thomas White Loan Charity, who provide loans for new business ideas and young businesses needing investment. For further information visit www.stwcharity.co.uk

Registration for this event is available from 9am for a 10am start. There will also be an opportunity to network after the event from 4pm - 6pm.

name: Nudge for Good: Harnessing Behavioural Science to Inform Business, Charity & Policy
html_description:
Behavioural science provides a powerful way to deepen our understanding of the drivers of human behaviour. In doing so it provides simple, cost-effective ways to change behaviour in desirable ways. For instance, it can help businesses increase profits by better appreciating the needs of consumers. Similarly, it can be used to promote socially beneficial behaviours such as recycling and safer driving.

During the event we will introduce key theories of behaviour change and show how they can be applied in business, public policy and the third sector. The focus will be on providing practical tools and methods that you can use. We shall also discuss a range of examples of behaviour change in action.

Speakers include; Professor Edward Cartwright, who is an expert in behavioural economics and Director of the Institute for Applied Economics and Social Value; Anna Cartwright, who is an Associate Professor in Economics at Coventry University and will talk about a project with the Home Office applying behaviour change in cyber-security; Charlotte Brown, who is a consultant for The Behavioural Architects, a global insight, research and consultancy business.

This event will be of interest to business, public policy and the third sector. Behavioural science provides simple and effective ways to think through problems from a different perspective. This event will equip you with the practical tools needed to apply behavioural science and instigate change.

 

Confirmed Speakers:

Edward Cartwright, Professor of Economics, De Montfort University

Anna Cartwright, Associate Professor, Coventry University

Charlotte Brown, Consultant, The Behavioural Architects

name: Digital Support for SMEs (Melton)
html_description:
Are you a Leicestershire SME missing out on FREE digital support?

Come along to this event to find out how to sign-up and access fully-funded digital support.

Leicester and Leicestershire businesses can benefit from a range of fully-funded workshops and seminars, the opportunity to receive financial help through grant funding and free one to one business advice to help introduce new digital technology.

The Digital Growth Programme is managed by East Midlands Chamber (Derbyshire, Nottinghamshire, Leicestershire). It is a programme part-funded by the European Regional Development Fund, the Chamber and Leicestershire County Council and is designed to help SMEs embrace new digital technology to improve productivity to aid growth.

The programme team are holding a number of information sessions inviting local SMEs who haven’t yet taken advantage of the digital support to attend to learn more about the programme and how to access the FREE support available.

By attending delegates will:

  • Discover what digital support is on offer
  • Learn about the success of the programme
  • Learn how, by embracing digital technology, they can improve productivity and business performance
  • Find out how to register and access the support*
  • Learn more about the grant funding and how to apply*

*eligibility criteria applies

Please note: there is no parking available at the venue. The nearest car park is Holiday Inn NCP, St Nicholas Circle, Leicester. LE1 4LF

 

Agenda

9am Arrival and networking

9.30am Welcome and programme overview

10am Meet the team

10.30am Opportunity to register onto the programme

11am Networking and close

 

Confirmed Speaker

Kam Atker, Events and Engagement Officer, Digital Growth Programme

name: Digital Marketing Hacks for SMEs
html_description:
Are you running a small B2C, bricks and mortar business?

Do you struggle to find the time to reach out to existing and new customers online?

Do you have social media accounts that are lying dormant?

Want to know some quick tips of where to invest your energy to see real results?

This workshop is aimed at small business owners of customer facing venues - restaurants, shops, bakeries, B&Bs and tourist attractions etc. Find out how to work smarter, not harder, when it comes to revitalising your digital presence.

Our quick tips will help you to reassess your website & search engine appearance, social media presence and how best to handle those pesky online review sites. Discover how to use your precious time more effectively when it comes to online marketing, without incurring additional spend through online advertising.

This event is aimed at those working in the retail, tourism and hospitality sectors - micro and small business owners who are responsible for every element of their business, including online marketing.

Attendees will be given plain English and easily implementable 'hacks' to improve the quality of their business’s digital presence. There is also an opportunity for a 121 consultation after the season to practically deal with any specific issues - bring your laptop or tablet!

Confirmed Speaker:

Laura Hadland, Director, Thirst Media - An experienced marketing professional who specialises in working with small businesses on their business strategy, brand image, marketing & PR and online presence.

Agenda:

9.15am arrival, registration, tea & coffee

9.30am Session part 1

10.25am Break

10.35am Session part 2

11.30am Close - 121 consultations available until 1pm

venue_street: Fischer County Ground, Curzon Road Entrance
name: Stand Up and Deliver: Communicating With Comedy
html_description:
Are you prepared to step out of your comfort zone to boost your business and your confidence using improvised comedy? 

You’ll get to learn a range of skills which will help you nail your business story and presentation style so you can win the hearts and minds of any business audience in any business context - whether you are looking for new customers or potential investors. You will uncover the key ingredients to develop your pitching, communication and team working skills. 

With his passion and charisma, international comedian Jarred Christmas will work with you to extract the confidence, enthusiasm and motivation you need to develop your presentation skills so you can showcase your business in its best light. 


This full day training workshop from the Business Gateway will include an informal mix of games and activities that will give you the tools and techniques to craft your communication skills. You will then have the opportunity later that evening to perform with the other participants to an audience. 

This event is aimed business owners who are looking to up-scale or grow their organisation. Qualifying criteria for delegates include: 
• 2 years accounts and a business plan 
• Minimum £500k turnover (previous trading year) 
• SME (under 250 employees) 
• Ambition for investment to grow your business and preferably receiving by some form of business support at present 
• A willingness to give it a go! No previous performance or comedy experience is necessary


All delegates must be available throughout the day of the workshop, plus the performance session until 7.00pm. 

Places for this training opportunity are limited. However, all applicants for this event will be considered to join the High Growth support or Scale-Up programmes delivered by the Business Gateway growth hub.


Deadline for expressions of interest is Monday 30th September 2019. 

Confirmed Host:

Jarred Christmas, an internationally respected comedian who has performed comedy for nearly 2 decades, and is widely regarded as one of the best improvisers around. Improvised comedy is a useful way of developing overall skills which will help you in your workplace, especially when preparing pitches, communicating with potential clients, promoting your overall business and developing your team.

name: Coaching for High Performance (Leicester)
html_description:
We all want our people to perform to their best of their ability don't we? That's how our business get results. Come to this session and see how, by bringing coaching into your management style, you can improve not only your performance, but also your employees performance too. 

But this won't be your average coaching training session. That's not how we do things at Blue Grape! We've teamed up with TSF Laser Clays to combine learning with fun and new experiences.  After an introduction to the concept of coaching, and some practical coaching tools, you’ll be split into teams to practice those coaching skills by having a laser shooting contest. The aim is to coach, give and receive feedback and help your team score as many points as possible.  This is coaching for high performance after all…..

This event is great for anyone who's responsible for the performance of other people, such as Business Owners, Managers, Team Leaders or Supervisors, or anyone responsible for training and development in their business. If you want to find a way to increase the performance of people around you - you should attend this event!

Attendees will learn the basics of coaching for high performance and how to increase the performance of your employees, improving productivity and quality. We all want that don't we?

name: How to Create Effective Customer-Centric Marketing Plans
html_description:
Have you noticed that you’re constantly saying/thinking/hearing ‘We should be doing X, Y and Z in our marketing’ yet never get around to it or feel that EVERYTHING feels urgent and important?

Do you struggle to plan out your marketing for the year or design website pages and user journeys that engage and convert?

These could be signs that it’s time to get back to basics and really understand your customer then design your marketing materials with them in mind. There can be a constant pull to be doing the ‘hot new thing’ and to feel pulled in a million directions at once. We’ve found that this process is a lot easier, in fact almost effortless when you’re crystal clear on what drives your customers.

In this interactive workshop we’ll take you through the process of grouping and defining your different customer groups into ‘personas’. Persona development is the first step in developing a marketing strategy that supports your business goals and returns a positive return on investment for your marketing spend.

In this workshop, we will work through the process of building up to 6 personas to be further refined and agreed with your team, then prioritise with the intention of building them into a marketing plan. We’ll help you understand the steps you’ll need to take to form into a marketing plan that is built around your customers to yield results.

Attendees will leave with a clearer understanding of their customers and where best to focus marketing efforts. The resulting documentation can be returned to again and again – to build a marketing plan, deciding which channels to focus attention on, writing messages on marketing materials, deciding which campaigns to run, briefing marketing creatives and more.

Confirmed Speaker:

Jessica Shailes, Ideal Marketing Company

name: A10 Digital Marketing Seminar
html_description:
The A10 Digital Marketing Seminar will include presentations and a Q&A sessions relating to latest developments in digital marketing, including topics such as:

  • PPC
  • SEO
  • Social Media
  • Technical aspects of websites and marketing

The event is aimed at anyone working within a marketing role within their business as well as small business owners looking to fully exploit the digital marketing opportunities available to maximise the profile of their organisation.

Delegates will take away tips, tricks and quick wins that can be implemented into their marketing campaigns and strategies.

Tea, coffee and a buffet lunch will be provided.

 

Confirmed Speakers

Ann Stanley, Managing Director, Anicca Digital

Chris Dowse, Head of Social Media

Sukh Singh, Head of SEO

Ed Truman, Head of Analytics & CRO

Holly Kelly, Paid Search Manager

Gurpreet Bassi, Head of Paid Search

 

About Anicca Digital, Organisers of the A10 Digital Marketing Seminar:

Anicca Digital are experts in the science of search, using owned and paid media to drive traffic, leads and sales. We are one of the biggest Google Partner agencies in the Midlands.

Working closely with our partners within Google we ensure our clients have access to the latest beta tests, data analysis and benchmarking tools and reports. Anicca works with third party tools to analyse competitor traffic and understand exactly how much and where your competitors are spending their marketing budget, allowing you the ability to differentiate and carve your niche.

Anicca formed a monthly networking group alongside other online marketing agencies in Leicestershire in 2015 called Leicester Digital. The goal was to get Leicester on the map as one of the leading cities in the digital marketing industry by providing a social and networking group that agencies, providers of digital technology, freelancers or individuals who have a keen interest in online marketing could meet at on a monthly basis. It is a fun, informal and informative networking session, with a mixture of traditional meet and greets as well as presentations from industry experts on specific topics.

The event quickly grew, and to meet the demands of the audience, Anicca set up the E-Commercial Conference towards the end of 2015, with the first one held at the Curve. 2016 saw a move to a bigger venue, The Marriott Hotel in Enderby, where the likes of Google, Bing, Whoop! Anicca and many more spoke and shared their knowledge on various topics from SEO, PR, Social Media, Search, Email Marketing & The Future Of Digital Shopping.

name: The Art of Deception: Recognising & Defeating Phishing & Social Engineering Attacks
html_description:
Online attacks and security breaches are becoming increasingly common as the attackers become more and more sophisticated in their approach and the art of deception.

This seminar will help you to spot various types of phishing and social engineering attacks on your business or organisation. You will learn how to defeat an attack and what you can do to avoid attacks happening again.

Social engineering involves being persuaded to do something that benefits the persuader. It relies heavily on human interaction and often involves manipulating people into breaking normal security procedures and best practices in order to gain access to systems, networks or physical locations, or for financial gain.

This session will introduce the many types of social engineering such as baiting, phishing, whaling, vishing, scareware, water-holing, diversion theft, honey trap and tailgating amongst others. It will discuss how you can spot attacks and how attacks can be prevented.

Aimed at owners of small businesses, with no internal IT support, and managers and directors of larger businesses who want to know more about socially engineered attacks on their organisations.

Attendees will gain an increased awareness of phishing, spear phishing & whaling attacks and other types of socially engineered attacks as well as a greater knowledge on how to defeat these attacks.

 

Agenda

9am Coffee/ tea/ breakfast rolls & networking

9.30am Seminar starts

10.30am -11am Seminar ends 

11am Q&A, networking & discussion

12noon Finish

name: The Second British Basketball Innovation Conference
html_description:
This national conference will focus on innovations in basketball including purpose-built arena build developments, lessons learnt and operational experience from Leicester, Newcastle and Sheffield. It will also examine innovative media and community engagement initiatives within the industry.

Attendees will find out more about:

  • How to develop new basketball facilities, which embrace both the needs of indoor sport and its communities
  • How to operate new basketball facilities to be sustainable
  • How best to engage funders
  • How basketball can contribute to cross-departmental objectives on improving health, educational outcomes and social engagement, especially in inner city community environments
  • How best to engage funders from the private sector
  • How community basketball clubs and third sector organisations, with whom they share objectives, can work together
  • Innovation in media including TV production for sport and the latest in media developments

The conference is suitable for professional & community basketball clubs, NGBs, sport funding agencies, county sport partnerships, schools, colleges and universities, basketball industry suppliers, arena architects, contractors and constructors, local authorities, digital marketing consultants, sport media executives, sports charities and foundations and representatives from non-sports partners interested in innovative community engagement.

 

Confirmed Speakers:

Paul Blake, Chairman of Newcastle Eagles

Kevin Routledge, Chairman, Leicester Riders

Bob Hope Head of Commercial BBL

Joe Harkin Head of Communications BBL

 

Agenda:

9am Registration

9.20am Welcome & In troduction

9.30am - 10am Keynote Speaker

10am - 1.30pm Workshops

1.30pm - 2pm Lunch break and networking

2pm - 3.30pm Workshops

4pm - 4.30pm Close

name: A Wealth of Opportunity: Competitions, Grants, Business Support, Tax Credits
html_description:
It costs money to innovate and grow successful businesses.

Within Leicestershire and the East Midlands there is a wealth of support and funding available for companies to access. This can be for capital equipment, innovation, job creation, apprenticeships and growth capital.

Learn about the funding and support available to businesses in Charnwood and the East Midlands area and connect with some of the key organisations that can help you find the right funding for your business.

“A Wealth of Opportunity” is an informal networking event to be held at the Organ Grinder in Loughborough on Thursday the 7th of November where you can talk to a number of key business support organisations.

This event, organised by LATi in partnership with inCharnwood, is open to all businesses – from SMEs to larger enterprises.

It will be particularly valuable for those who are searching for new sources of funding, are looking to expand their businesses, or wish to set up business in the region, as well as heads and senior decision makers of high-tech and scientific businesses including:

·       Advanced manufacturing and engineering

·       Life sciences, biosciences and healthcare

·       Sports science and sports technology

·       Space and satellite technology

·       Low carbon industry

·       Professional services

·       Business support

·       Funding support

Funding experts experienced in working with Life Sciences, Advanced Manufacturing, Engineering and High-Tech will be attending and speaking at this networking event.

Attendees will get the opportunity to:

·       Meet with industry peers and talk about business topics that matter to you

·       Make useful business connections

·       Find out about support available for businesses

·       Discover new business funding options

·       Create new collaboration opportunities

·       Be part a vibrant business community

·       Highlight your own activities, to network, share knowledge, and establish synergies.

About InCharnwood

InCharnwood is an initiative by Charnwood Borough Council, which has been developed to market the area to businesses and attract inward investment to create a stronger local economy. www.incharnwood.com@inCharnwood

About LATi

LATi, a thriving networking group for people who work in high-tech, science and engineering, was established in Loughborough in 1996 as a ‘science park without walls’. Today, the not-for-profit provides networking and business support for companies and individuals involved in the innovative use of science and technology. http://lati.org.uk/ @LATILtd

 

Confirmed Speakers:

Sam Stephens, Director of TBAT Innovation will provide an update on funding from Innovate UK and HMRC R&D Tax Credits

Victoria Patel, Project Leader in Innovation at Medilink East Midlands will cover the support available under the ERDF-funded SOLSTICE programme for Life Science companies in Leicester and Leicestershire.

Jeff Mallows, Senior Business Advisor at innovate2succeed will talk about the innovate2succeed programme and how it can help you nurture innovation more effectively, rapidly commercialise concepts, and grow your bottom line,

Helen Miller, Growth Hub Manager, LLEP Business Gateway Growth Hub will cover the Growth Hub’s support services available, including business growth and access to finance, grants and loans.

Agenda

5.30pm Networking and refreshments

6pm Welcome – Chris Grace, inCharnwood

6.10pm– Innovate UK and R&D Tax Credits

6.25pm ERDF-funded SOLSTICE programme

6.40pm innovate2succeed programme

6.55pm Business Gateway Growth Hub

7.10pm Interactive session

7.30pm Close
